title: Jeff J.J. Star Duran - 2 Decades Of Defiance
description:
Dandurand's mother was the first to nurture his creative aspirations and began taking him on auditions by the time he was 11. Dandurand was able to obtain management and sign with the Savage Agency, which resulted in bit parts on television and in film. Jeff Duran began his career as a child actor appearing in one episode of Tough Cookies, a short-lived sitcom that starred Robby Benson. Jeff's role as "kid auto thief" was omitted from the theatrical release of No Man's Land, a 1987 film starring Charlie Sheen and then unknown Brad Pitt who played a "waiter". According to IMDB, Jeff also appeared in Twilight Zone and the ABC series The Wonder Years episodes: "Math Class" (1989) and "Rock and Roll" (1990) as Jeff Dandurand. 



Jeff began his radio career at KCLB 93.7 in Palm Springs, California where he worked from 1994 through 1995. To get back on the air, Dandurand paid out of his pocket to host a radio show called L.A. Rock Scene. This led to full time work at KIXA, a small rock station in Victorville, California. 

Jeff caught a break hosting "Metalblitz Radio" on KLSX, an FM talk station in Los Angeles that also carried The Howard Stern Show."Metalblitz Radio" was funded by MUSICBLITZ Records, a web based label, and became the subject of high profile articles and a sold out live show. Jeff appeared on an episode of the Late Late Show as a result of his weekly show. Although the show had good ratings for KLSX, "Metalblitz Radio" was dropped when MUSICBLITZ Records folded the following year.
 

On Southern California radio, Jeff has been most-known as the "rock and roll junkie." At KLSX, KCXX and KIXA, Dandurand would urge callers to stump the junkie on his vast music knowledge, with the listener normally losing to challenge. Duran retired the bit because he felt New York radio personality Eddie Trunk ripped it off. Duran includes the "rock and roll junkie" sound bite on his mixtapes.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“DuranÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ resurfaced in Riverside, working for KCXX an alternative rock station.At KCXX, Jeff worked his way from weekend announcer to Morning Drive co host. This led to a solo morning gig at active rock station KKXX-FM in Bakersfield. In January 2006, Jeff returned to Los Angeles to resume his comedy career.



Duran has worked as a radio personality on:
KKXX104.3 FM in Bakersfield, California
KCXX 103.9 in Riverside, California
KLSX 97.1 in Los Angeles
KIXA 106.5 in Victorville, California
KCLB 93.7 in Palm Springs, California
KKZQ 100.1 in Tehachapi, California
KOCP 95.9 in Ventura, California

 
In 2007, Dandurand returned to radio as afternoon drive host on modern rock station KKZQ in Palmdale, California. Jeff also became Music Director and assistant Program Director in addition to his daily radio show. Duran Show was also carried briefly in Ventura, CA on the now defunct KOCP 95.9.

Many guests appeared on the Duran Show, including Lady Gaga, who would frequent the show before becoming an international phenomenon.Duran parted ways with KKZQ in early 2011.

In January 2012, the Duran Show was re-launched in conjunction with the Beverly Hills based celebrity gossip site Paparazzidaily.com


Jeff's presence on radio helped his edgy stand up act, opening for the likes of Carlos Mencia, Pauly Shore, Dave Attell and Doug Stanhope. Dandurand has performed at comedy clubs such as Comedy Store, Improv, Laugh Factory and music venues such as House Of Blues and Whisky Au Go Go. Jeff's comedy has been featured on the Late, Late Show, National Lampoon and subject of the documentary film 'How Embarrassing' which he also produced.


J.J. Star is the stage name and alternate persona of Jeff Dandurand --often described as a triple threat for his versatility as an comedian, actor and radio personality. "JJ Star" was originally intended to be a rock star but was considered too ambitious and over the top for the musical climate of that time. JJ had to channel his rock star dreams into a career as radio personality and stand up comedian. Dandurand started performing stand up at age 17 alongside comedians Jamie Kennedy, Dane Cook and Brian Holtzman in Los Angeles.


JJ Star has toured as an emcee and opening act for Carlos Mencia, Pauly Shore, Mike Epps,Dave Attell and Doug Stanhope. Dandurand incorporates music and characters into his stand up routine which for several years was considered one of the most outrageous comedians since Sam Kinison.  

Dandurand has released four studio albums as Jeff "JJ Star" Duran. Most notable is How Embarrassing, released March 9, 2011, the double album featured Lady Gaga. How Embarrassing inspired a documentary that   chronicles the 20 year career of Jeff ''J.J. Star" Duran. Archival footage and interviews provide the backdrop to the real story behind his persona as a radio personality and outlaw stand up up comic. 

He has written, recorded and produced over 700 songs, most notable is "Rebellion" by  Britney Spears .In recent years he has released several mixtapes for artists like Lil Wayne, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar & Lana Del Rey. As an artist his mixtapes have been downloaded as many times as Soulja Boy, T.I., Rick Ross & Others on the datpiff.com website.  Dandurand has also worked A&R contributed to biographies on Lady Gaga, Green Day, Metallica, Guns N Roses, Katy Perry and Tool. 


A powerful , positive and larger than life force of personality, Dandurand brings a special brand of empathy to his life coaching work to share his wisdom, compassion and enthusiasm for life with what he calls "Talks Of Truth". Dandurand teaches an accessible process of discovering spiritual identity and it's inerent power. Although some "talks" deal in conspiracy theory, Dandurand teaches that one cannot evolve politically, socially or economically until one evolves spiritually.
